titleStmt.title: Gentle Reader, let me intreate thee to amend these faults, which otherwise may leade into errour.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Gentle Reader, let me intreate thee to amend these faults, which otherwise may leade into errour.

monogr.title: A commentarie vpon the fourth booke of Moses, called Numbers : Containing, the foundation of the church and common-wealth of the Israelites, while they walked and wandered in the vvildernesse. Laying before vs the vnchangeable loue of God promised and exhibited to this people ... Heerein also the reader shall finde more then fiue hundred theologicall questions, decided and determined by William Attersoll, minister of the word
monogr.author: Attersoll, William

div.head: Gentle Reader, let me intreate thee to amend these faults, which otherwise may leade into errour.
div.p: PAg. 18. Col. 2. line 6. had made. pag. 79. col. 2. l. 37. the iudgement. pag. 80, c. 1. l. 1. desired, p. 137. c. 1. l. 60. rule and, p. 140. c. 1. l. 56. censor. p. 167. c. 2. l. 5. not to do. p. 206. c. 2. l. 22. vnprobable, p. 301. c. 1. l. 26. the Cushite. p. 394. c. 2. l. 18. the Cushite. p. 422. c. 1. l. 5. his iudgements. p. 451. c. 1. l. 30. tender. p. 473. c. 2. l. 36. profitable. p. 536. c. 2. l. 28. the staffe. p. 588. c. 1. l. 47, a double.
